q: What port does DNS typically use?
a: UDP/53 (and TCP/53 for zone transfers/large responses).
why: Most queries are UDP for speed; TCP is used when reliability/size demands it.

q: What is the difference between a hub and a switch?
a: A hub repeats traffic to all ports; a switch forwards frames based on MAC addresses.
why: Switching reduces collisions and improves efficiency by learning MAC-to-port mappings.
